cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the Yucatan Peninsula, then north-northwest across the central Gulf with a projected approach to the north-western Gulf Coast (TX/LA border area).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near the Texas-Louisiana border (close to Port Arthur area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula (near-term) and the north-western Gulf Coast from Texas to Louisiana (days 4-5)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible at Port Arthur by Monday night-Tuesday with a low (but increasing) chance of 50-kt gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the system reaches the upper Texas coast as a strong tropical storm or minimal hurricane, a 2–4 ft surge is possible in Sabine Lake and adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall totals of 4–6 inches (locally higher) are possible, creating flash-flood risk in the port vicinity.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tropical-cyclone spawned tornadoes and dangerous seas/long-period swells may disrupt vessel movements and berth operations.
